bibl.title: House of Representatives Bill No. 11686, March 2, 1928

div1.p: This is a pension bill for the Yellow Fever Commission survivors and volunteers.

div1.head: House of Representatives Bill No. 11686, March 2, 1928
div1.opener:
70th CONGRESS
1st Session
H.R. 11686
____________________
IN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
MARCH 2, 1928
Mr. WAINWRIGHT introduced the following bill; which was referred to the
Committee on Military Affairs and ordered to be printed
____________________
div1.p:
To provide for the placing of the names of certain individuals on
the rolls of the War Department, and to authorize the Board
of Regents of the Smithsonian Institution to make certain
recommendations.

1 Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representa-
2 tives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,
3 That in special recognition of the high public service ren-
4 dered, and disabilities contracted in the interest of humanity
5 and science as voluntary subjects for the experimentations
6 during the yellow fever investigations in Cuba, the Secretary
7 of War be, and hereby is, authorized and directed to place
2
1 on the rolls of the War Department, the names of Mrs.
2 Walter Reed, Mrs. James Carroll, Mrs. Jesse W. Lazear,
3 Doctor Aristides Agramonte; private John H. Andrus,
4 Hospital Corps; Mr. John R. Bullard, private A. W. Cov-
5 ington, Twenty-third Battery, Coast Artillery Corps; private
6 William H. Deans, Troop B, Seventh Cavalry; private
7 Wallace Forbes, Hospital Corps; private Levi E. Folk,
8 Hospital Corps; private P. Hamann, Twenty-third Battery,
9 Coast Artillery Corps; private James F. Hanberry, Hospital
10 Corps; Mrs. Warren G. Jernegan, private John R. Kis-
11 singer; Mr. John J. Moran; private William Olson, Hospital
12 Corps; private Charles G. Sonntag, Hospital Corps; private
13 Clyde L. West, Hospital Corps; Doctor R. P. Cooke; private
14 Thomas H. England, Hospital Corps; private James Hilde-
15 brand, Hospital Corps; private Edward Weatherwalks, 20
16 Hospital Corps. And the Secretary of War is hereby di-
17 rected to pay to the foregoing, during the remainder of
18 their natural lives, the sum of $250 per month in lieu of any
19 and all pensions now received.

20 SEC. 2. That the Board of Regents of the Smithsonian
21 Institution is hereby authorized to investigate all cases of
22 citizens employed in the public service of the United States
23 who through voluntary risk of life and health shall have
24 rendered conspicuous service to the people of the country.
3
1 and shall have power to recommend to the Congress of the
2 United States the amount and nature of the recognition to
3 which such citizens are justly entitled, and shall report to the
4 Congress in detail the circumstances surrounding such
5 service.
